message: The site seems cool and all, but I'm wondering if I'm missing something...
pg tweeted recently:  "We're trying to figure out why this YC batch did so well. One theory: they all used Convore (http://convore.com)."
high quality real time psuedoanonymous chat

and by high quality, I mean high signal to noise ratio (though the tech is also great). Unfortunately, for it to make any money, the unwashed masses are going to have to find out about it- and the high quality bit will disappear

I love the private chat option - I hope to use it with a few friends who are 1000s of miles away. Right now we are staying in touch by emailing each other. Having a convore stream going on about all things on our minds would be great. Unfortunately, I don't think I'd pay for it. I would've if I had any money, but at the moment if they were to charged I'd go back to email. Great product, so hopefully Google buys you guys in no time, as a Wave replacement, and we could all use it for free, and for always!
looks kind of like Google Wave? I always wondered why that didn't take off, was a cool way of interacting..
Has anyone already switched from Skype to Convore and been happy with it?
@intelliot Meet random people with the same interests
how is Convore better than Gmail? is it the Facebook/Twitter integration?
I agree, it's closer to google wave idea than simply gmail. for me it's usenet meets irc in th browser.
@yplancqueel I've been trying to others to switch from Skype. Convore's notifications and mobile application are so much better
What would make it greater for me is XMPP integration
The two things that keep me coming back are the high signal to noise ratio and the overall politeness of the community.
Just feels like a fancy forum to me. If it gets bigger, it will suffer from the same problems as forums, but at the moment there is a level of quality.
Fancy stuff is what made the difference between MySpace and Facebook.
convore is easy to use!

@mcuk convore is still young, the fact that they model convore as IRC makes me feels warm and fuzzy. I like the idea of the creator of a group becomes the mod (or op if you prefer IRC lingo), as opposed to usual forum where they have a group of people appointed to be the mods of the whole site
i like it so far. don't know why but i keep checking it every day + on my phone. :)
It's true for me too @elvin.  I check it just after Twitter.
@unwrangle there are super mods for the whole forums and there are mods for specific forums. it doesn’t have to be the whole site.

@MikeT but it's still an appointed person to moderate that forum,.. any user can't  create a category and moderate on his/her own... again, taking notes from IRC is one of the best part for Convore...
